title: Galileo Galilei - 15 Books (gnv64)
description:
Galileo Galilei (15 February 1564 Ã¢â‚¬â€œ 8 January 1642), was an Italian astronomer, physicist, engineer, philosopher, and mathematician who played a major role in the scientific revolution during the Renaissance. He is widely heralded as one of the greatest scientists of all time.
His achievements include improvements to the telescope and consequent astronomical observations and support for Copernicanism. Galileo has been called the "father of modern observational astronomy", the "father of modern physics", the "father of science", and "the father of modern science".
His contributions to observational astronomy include the telescopic confirmation of the phases of Venus, the discovery of the four largest satellites of Jupiter (named the Galilean moons in his honour), and the observation and analysis of sunspots. Galileo also worked in applied science and technology, inventing an improved military compass and other instruments.
Here is a collection of 15 books about him as I had promised in my earlier torrent containing "the cambridge companion to Galileo" Also included is the wikipedia article on him. Covers are included in a separate folder:

01. From Galileo to Gell-Mann - The Wonder that Inspired the Greatest Scientists of All Time In Their Own Words
02. Galileo - Renaissance Scientist And Astronomer
03. Galileo - Scientist and Stargazer (What's Their Story)
04. Galileo and 400 Years of Telescopic Astronomy
05. Galileo and the Dolphins - Amazing But True Stories from Science
06. Galileo Galilei - First Physicist
07. Galileo Galilei - When the World Stood
08. Galileo in Rome - The Rise and Fall of a Troublesome Genius
09. Galileo's Daughter - A Historical Memoir of Science, Faith, and Love
10. Galileo's Glassworks - The Telescope and the Mirror
11. Galileo's Pendulum - From the Rhythm of Time to the Making of Matter
12. Great Physicists - The Life and Times of Leading Physicists from Galileo to Hawking
13. The Essential Galileo
14. Thus Spoke Galileo - The great scientist's ideas and their relevance to the present day
15. What Galileo Saw - Imagining the Scientific Revolution
